channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Walmart hikes its outlook again as shoppers spend more outside the grocery aisles
item.description: The discounter will deliver its latest sales results as inflation cools and the holiday season heats up.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Edge Lower
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures edged lower, relinquishing part of the previous day’s gains, with the market focused on expectations for coming cold weather ...

item.title: Stocks Move Lower and Bond Yields Decline
item.description: The S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite all declined as geopolitical tensions weighed on market sentiment and boosted safe-haven buying.

item.title: Lowe's beats on earnings and hikes guidance, but still expects sales to fall this year
item.description: Lowe's topped quarterly earnings and revenue estimates, but even its raised sales outlook would be a decline from last year.

item.title: Germany's Thyssenkrupp pops 10% after narrowing net loss and booking $1 billion impairment charge
item.description: Thyssenkrupp on Tuesday reported a 1-billion-euro ($1 billion) impairment on its struggling steel division.

item.title: Alibaba posts profit beat as China looks to prop up tepid consumer spend
item.description: The results come at a tricky time for Chinese commerce businesses, given the broad sluggishness in the world's second-largest economy.

item.title: Gold Futures Gain, Reclaiming Some Ground; Focus Shifts to Fed Meeting
item.description: Gold futures gained, buoyed by sliding Treasury yields and SP Angel said focus now turns to the Fed’s December meeting, as renewed inflation concerns ...

item.title: Car-Loan Delinquencies Aren't Scaring Off Wall Street
item.description: Investors are snapping up bonds tied to car loans, betting that a strong U.S. economy will keep rising delinquency rates in check.

item.title: Here's why investors are so excited about Disney's quarterly results
item.description: After several quarters of underperformance and investor frustration, CEO Robert Iger's turnaround plans appear to be working.

item.title: Euro Could Recover as ECB-Fed Rate Bet Divergence Looks Overdone
item.description: The euro was down against the dollar but could recover as the divergence in expectations for ECB and Fed interest-rate cuts looks overdone, according ...
